metadata.title: CVE-2015-8856 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the serve-index package before1.6.3 for Node.js allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script orHTML via a crafted file or directory name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-serve-index - 1.9.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-serve-index package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.1-1').
